attributes.action: call a parliamentary debate on the health risks of television watching.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There have been a number of studies published by the scientific and medical world regarding television viewing and its damaging affects on health. There is also concern regarding the impact the television is having on public behaviour.

The area of most concern is the damage television viewing may be doing to young children’s learning abilities. Some doctors and scientists now say that a major cause of ADHD (Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder) in children is due to excessive television watching. And now say that young children should not be exposed to the television at all. 

Adults too are in danger if they have watched television since childhood and could risk serious illnesses. Television viewing has also been cited as a major cause of depression, insomnia, heart disease and also violence in society.

This is a call for a parliamentary debate on the health risks of television viewing with a consideration the television screen should display a health warning.
